citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The facility’s Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC ) has not performed its functions including reviewing
the facility's program for humane care and use of animals, inspection of the animal facilities, and submitting reports to the
Institutional Official at least once every six months as required. The facility did not have an IACUC review/inspection
between September 8, 2023 and November 18, 2024. These IACUC functions are necessary to ensure oversight of the
care and use of animals involved in research activity. Schedule and perform the review of the research facility's program
for humane care and use of animals, the facility inspection, and report the findings to the Institutional Official at least once
every six months.
Correct by May 16, 2025.

A written program of veterinary care for dogs was not available for review at the time of inspection. The facility employs a
full-time attending veterinarian who is responsible for overseeing the veterinary care provided to all the animals at the
facility; however, there is no written program documented regarding veterinary care for the dogs. A written program of
veterinary care for dogs is crucial to ensure the dogs are receiving proper medical and preventative care and that the
facility is following the attending veterinarian's guidance. The registrant must develop a written program of veterinary care
for dogs with all the components required and outlined in section 3.13(a).
Correct by February 28, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.31(c) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The facility’s Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC ) has not performed its functions including reviewing 
the facility's program for humane care and use of animals, inspection of the animal facilities, and submitting reports to the 
Institutional Official at least once every six months as required. The facility did not have an IACUC review/inspection 
between September 8, 2023 and November 18, 2024. These IACUC functions are necessary to ensure oversight of the 
care and use of animals involved in research activity. Schedule and perform the review of the research facility's program 
for humane care and use of animals, the facility inspection, and report the findings to the Institutional Official at least once 
every six months. 
 
Correct by May 16, 2025. 
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
A written program of veterinary care for dogs was not available for review at the time of inspection. The facility employs a 
full-time attending veterinarian who is responsible for overseeing the veterinary care provided to all the animals at the 
facility; however, there is no written program documented regarding veterinary care for the dogs. A written program of 
veterinary care for dogs is crucial to ensure the dogs are receiving proper medical and preventative care and that the 
facility is following the attending veterinarian's guidance. The registrant must develop a written program of veterinary care 
for dogs with all the components required and outlined in section 3.13(a).  
 
Correct by February 28, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
